Case Study: Simple Table from the Economist

Source: vignettes/case-study-simple-table-from-the-economist.Rmd
case-study-simple-table-from-the-economist.Rmd
company_fundamentals <-
  tribble(
    ~company,     ~revenue_bn, ~net_income_bn, ~employees,
    "Apple",      46.7,        9.4,            34300,
    "Google",     23.7,        6.5,            19835,
    "Microsoft",  58.7,        16.3,           93000,
    "Intel",      35.1,        4.4,            79800,
    "HP",         117.0,       8.0,            304000,
    "IBM",        95.8,        13.4,           399409,
    "Oracle",     23.2,        5.8,            86000,
    "Cisco",      35.5,        6.1,            68574)
  
company_fundamentals
#> # A tibble: 8 x 4
#>   company   revenue_bn net_income_bn employees
#>   <chr>          <dbl>         <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 Apple           46.7           9.4     34300
#> 2 Google          23.7           6.5     19835
#> 3 Microsoft       58.7          16.3     93000
#> 4 Intel           35.1           4.4     79800
#> 5 HP             117             8      304000
#> 6 IBM             95.8          13.4    399409
#> 7 Oracle          23.2           5.8     86000
#> 8 Cisco           35.5           6.1     68574
activity_by_market <-
  tribble(
    ~company, ~procs, ~comps, ~neteqm, ~mobdev, ~sw,
    ~apps, ~webservs, ~ol_ads, ~cloud, ~itservs,
    "Apple",     3,  1,  NA, 1,  1,  1,  2,  3,  NA, NA,
    "Google",    NA, 3,  NA, 3,  1,  NA, 1,  1,  1,  NA,
    "Microsoft", NA, NA, NA, 3,  1,  1,  1,  1,  1,  2,
    "Intel",     1,  NA, NA, NA, 1,  NA, NA, NA, NA, NA,
    "HP",        NA, 1,  1,  1,  1,  NA, 3,  NA, 2,  1,
    "IBM",       1,  1,  2,  NA, 1,  3,  3,  NA, 1,  1,
    "Oracle",    1,  1,  3,  NA, 1,  1,  2,  NA, NA, 2,
    "Cisco",     1,  2,  1,  3,  NA, NA, 1,  NA, NA, 1)

activity_by_market
#> # A tibble: 8 x 11
#>   company procs comps neteqm mobdev    sw  apps webservs ol_ads cloud
#>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 Apple       3     1     NA      1     1     1        2      3    NA
#> 2 Google     NA     3     NA      3     1    NA        1      1     1
#> 3 Microsâ€¦    NA    NA     NA      3     1     1        1      1     1
#> 4 Intel       1    NA     NA     NA     1    NA       NA     NA    NA
#> 5 HP         NA     1      1      1     1    NA        3     NA     2
#> 6 IBM         1     1      2     NA     1     3        3     NA     1
#> 7 Oracle      1     1      3     NA     1     1        2     NA    NA
#> 8 Cisco       1     2      1      3    NA    NA        1     NA    NA
#> # ... with 1 more variable: itservs <dbl>
order_companies <- c("Apple", "Google", "Microsoft", "Intel", "HP", "IBM", "Oracle", "Cisco")
order_fundamentals <- c("revenue_bn", "net_income_bn", "employees")
order_markets <- c("procs", "comps", "neteqm", "mobdev", "sw", "apps", "webservs", "ol_ads", "cloud", "itservs")
company_fundamentals_w <- 
  company_fundamentals %>%
  tidyr::gather(metric, value, revenue_bn, net_income_bn, employees, -company) %>%
  tidyr::spread(key = company, value) %>%
  dplyr::arrange(factor(metric, levels = order_fundamentals)) %>%
  dplyr::select("metric", order_companies)

company_fundamentals_w
#> # A tibble: 3 x 9
#>   metric       Apple  Google Microsoft  Intel     HP     IBM Oracle  Cisco
#>   <chr>        <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1 revenue_bn    46.7    23.7      58.7 3.51e1    117  9.58e1 2.32e1 3.55e1
#> 2 net_incomâ€¦     9.4     6.5      16.3 4.40e0      8  1.34e1 5.80e0 6.10e0
#> 3 employees  34300   19835     93000   7.98e4 304000  3.99e5 8.60e4 6.86e4

activity_by_market_w <- 
  activity_by_market %>%
  tidyr::gather(metric, value, 2:ncol(activity_by_market), -company) %>%
  tidyr::spread(key = company, value) %>%
  dplyr::arrange(factor(metric, levels = order_markets)) %>%
  dplyr::select("metric", order_companies) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(groupname = "activity_levels")

activity_by_market_w
#> # A tibble: 10 x 10
#>    metric  Apple Google Microsoft Intel    HP   IBM Oracle Cisco groupname
#>    <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <chr>    
#>  1 procs       3     NA        NA     1    NA     1      1     1 activityâ€¦
#>  2 comps       1      3        NA    NA     1     1      1     2 activityâ€¦
#>  3 neteqm     NA     NA        NA    NA     1     2      3     1 activityâ€¦
#>  4 mobdev      1      3         3    NA     1    NA     NA     3 activityâ€¦
#>  5 sw          1      1         1     1     1     1      1    NA activityâ€¦
#>  6 apps        1     NA         1    NA    NA     3      1    NA activityâ€¦
#>  7 webserâ€¦     2      1         1    NA     3     3      2     1 activityâ€¦
#>  8 ol_ads      3      1         1    NA    NA    NA     NA    NA activityâ€¦
#>  9 cloud      NA      1         1    NA     2     1     NA    NA activityâ€¦
#> 10 itservs    NA     NA         2    NA     1     1      2     1 activityâ€¦
combined_tibble <- 
  bind_rows(company_fundamentals_w, activity_by_market_w) %>%
  rename(rowname = metric)

combined_tibble
#> # A tibble: 13 x 10
#>    rowname   Apple  Google Microsoft   Intel     HP     IBM  Oracle   Cisco
#>    <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>
#>  1 revenuâ€¦    46.7    23.7      58.7    35.1    117  9.58e1    23.2    35.5
#>  2 net_inâ€¦     9.4     6.5      16.3     4.4      8  1.34e1     5.8     6.1
#>  3 employâ€¦ 34300   19835     93000   79800   304000  3.99e5 86000   68574  
#>  4 procs       3      NA        NA       1       NA  1.00e0     1       1  
#>  5 comps       1       3        NA      NA        1  1.00e0     1       2  
#>  6 neteqm     NA      NA        NA      NA        1  2.00e0     3       1  
#>  7 mobdev      1       3         3      NA        1 NA         NA       3  
#>  8 sw          1       1         1       1        1  1.00e0     1      NA  
#>  9 apps        1      NA         1      NA       NA  3.00e0     1      NA  
#> 10 webserâ€¦     2       1         1      NA        3  3.00e0     2       1  
#> 11 ol_ads      3       1         1      NA       NA NA         NA      NA  
#> 12 cloud      NA       1         1      NA        2  1.00e0    NA      NA  
#> 13 itservs    NA      NA         2      NA        1  1.00e0     2       1  
#> # ... with 1 more variable: groupname <chr>
data <-
  gt(data = combined_tibble) %>%
  tab_stubhead_caption(md("**Company**")) %>%
  fmt_missing(columns = TRUE, missing_text = " ") %>%
  fmt_number(columns = TRUE, rows = "employees", decimals = 0) %>%
  fmt_number(columns = TRUE, rows = c(1, 2), decimals = 1) %>%
  tab_heading(title = md("**Tech giants invade each other's turf**")) %>%
  tab_style(
    style = paste0(apply_styles(text_align = "left", text_indent = 5), "padding-bottom:20px"),
    locations = cells_title(groups = "title")) %>%
  tab_options(heading.border.bottom.width = px(0))

data
Tech giants invade each other's turf
Company Apple Google Microsoft Intel HP IBM Oracle Cisco
revenue_bn 46.7 23.7 58.7 35.1 117.0 95.8 23.2 35.5
net_income_bn 9.4 6.5 16.3 4.4 8.0 13.4 5.8 6.1
employees 34,300 19,835 93,000 79,800 304,000 399,409 86,000 68,574
activity_levels
procs 3 1 1 1 1
comps 1 3 1 1 1 2
neteqm 1 2 3 1
mobdev 1 3 3 1 3
sw 1 1 1 1 1 1 1
apps 1 1 3 1
webservs 2 1 1 3 3 2 1
ol_ads 3 1 1
cloud 1 1 2 1
itservs 2 1 1 2 1
